title: Executive authority of Malta

content.text: (1) The executive authority of Malta is vested in the President.
(2) The executive authority of Malta shall be exercised by the President, either directly or through officers subordinate to him, in accordance with the provisions of this Constitution.
(3) Nothing in this article shall prevent Parliament from conferring functions on the President or on persons or authorities other than the President.

amendmentHistory.description: Substituted by Act LVIII of 1974, amended by Act XLIV of 2020

notes: This article establishes that the executive authority of Malta is vested in the President and outlines how this authority should be exercised.
